title: NFC contact card:
description: Custom-made contact PCB card that redirects to my LinkedIn page when tapping on a phone. The card has an NFC chip and an LED that lights up upon contact.

title: Gaze-controlled game:
description: This is a full-stack neurotechnology project involving both hardware and firmware development components. The eye-tracking system is based on electrooculography (EOG) technique (not cameras, as compared to the standard in AR/VR applications), and allows basic control of a Chrome dinosaur game with blinks. On the GIF, electrodes are attached to the area above and below my eye that measures voltage difference between the two sites. That signal is later filtered and amplifier through an analog front-end PCB that later connects to a laptop for visualization.
